page.title: 09The Creamery-Cropwell Bishop
page.content: Tankers bring milk from the local farms and empty it into the Creamery's silos, which hold 30,000 litres(7,500 gallons) of milk. After 24 hours it is pasteurised and put in a holding tank.The starter(a type of bacteria), and rennet(to make the milk sour) are added. Then it starts to turn into cheese.The cheese goes onto the curd table,where the curds are broken up. After that the cheese goes into a moulding machine then into a tray then into hoops which have a nylon net attached to them.When the cheese has solidified the net is thrown away. After hand-cleaning the trays the hoops are machined cleaned They wrap the cheese in cling-film.And wax paper It goes in a oven.After that they put them into crates and put the crates in a room which is 45 f if the cheese gets warm it goes squechy and gooey.
